It might be more effective to use a variety of communication methods when dealing with clients who have ADHD. This can allow them to absorb information in different ways, which may assist their ability to concentrate and stay focused during the conversation. Some options include:

1. In-person meetings: Schedule regular face-to-face meetings, as this allows for direct eye contact and immediate clarification of any questions or concerns.

2. Written communication: Provide important information in written forms like emails or handouts, so clients have a tangible resource they can refer back to later.

3. Visual aids: Use visual materials such as charts, graphs, infographics, or presentations during conversations to help illustrate points and maintain attention.

4. Phone calls: Conduct phone check-ins or conference calls periodically if necessary but keep them brief and focused.

5. Video conferencing: Utilize video calling tools for remote clients – it combines visual aids with face-to-face interaction and enables screen sharing capabilities for real-time collaboration on documents.
